00059 StateData state_data;
00060 GPtrArray *objectData = NULL;
00061 GPtrArray *registered = NULL;
00062 gboolean isVerbose;

00069 gint
00070 get_policy_string (const gchar *gconfpath)
00071 {
00072     GConfClient *client = NULL;
00073     gchar *valuestr = NULL;
00074     gint value;
00075 
00076     /* assertion checks */
00077     g_assert (gconfpath);
00078 
00079     client = gconf_client_get_default ();
00080     valuestr = gconf_client_get_string (client, gconfpath, NULL);
00081     if (!valuestr) {
00082         g_warning ("Cannot find %s, maybe a bug in the gconf schema!", gconfpath);
00083         return 0;
00084     }
00085     value = convert_string_to_policy (valuestr);
00086     g_free (valuestr);
00087     return value;
00088 }
00089 
00097 static void
00098 callback_gconf_key_changed (GConfClient *client,
00099     guint cnxn_id,
00100     GConfEntry *entry,
00101     gpointer user_data)
00102 {
00103     gint value = 0;
00104 
00105     /* assertion checks */
00106     g_assert (client);
00107     g_assert (entry);
00108 
00109     g_debug ("callback_gconf_key_changed (%s)", entry->key);
00110 
00111     if (gconf_entry_get_value (entry) == NULL)
00112         return;
00113 
00114     if (strcmp (entry->key, GCONF_ROOT "general/display_icon") == 0) {
00115         gpn_icon_update ();
00116     } else if (strcmp (entry->key, GCONF_ROOT "general/display_icon_full") == 0) {
00117         gpn_icon_update ();
00118     } else if (strcmp (entry->key, GCONF_ROOT "policy/battery/sleep_computer") == 0) {
00119         /* set new suspend timeouts */
00120         value = gconf_client_get_int (client, entry->key, NULL);
00121         if (state_data.onBatteryPower)
00122             gpm_idle_set_timeout (value);
00123     } else if (strcmp (entry->key, GCONF_ROOT "policy/ac/sleep_computer") == 0) {
00124         /* set new suspend timeouts */
00125         value = gconf_client_get_int (client, entry->key, NULL);
00126         if (!state_data.onBatteryPower)
00127             gpm_idle_set_timeout (value);
00128     } else if (strcmp (entry->key, GCONF_ROOT "policy/battery/sleep_display") == 0) {
00129         /* set new suspend timeouts */
00130         if (state_data.onBatteryPower) {
00131             value = gconf_client_get_int (client, entry->key, NULL);
00132             gscreensaver_set_dpms_timeout (value);
00133         }
00134     } else if (strcmp (entry->key, GCONF_ROOT "policy/ac/sleep_display") == 0) {
00135         /* set new suspend timeouts */
00136         if (!state_data.onBatteryPower) {
00137             value = gconf_client_get_int (client, entry->key, NULL);
00138             gscreensaver_set_dpms_timeout (value);
00139         }
00140     }
00141 
00142 }

00151 static gboolean
00152 dbus_action (gint action)
00153 {
00154     gpm_emit_about_to_happen (action);
00155 #if 0
00156     RegProgram *regprog = NULL;
00157     gint a;
00158     const gint maxwait = 5;
00159     gboolean retval;
00160 
00161     gboolean allACK = FALSE;
00162     gboolean anyNACK = FALSE;
00163 
00164     if (registered->len == 0) {
00165         g_debug ("No connected clients");
00166         retval = TRUE;
00167         goto unref;
00168     }
00169     g_debug ("Registered clients = %i", registered->len);
00170 
00171     GTimer* gt = g_timer_new ();
00172     do {
00173 
00174         g_main_context_iteration (NULL, TRUE);
00175         if (!g_main_context_pending (NULL))
00176             g_usleep (100*1000);
00177 
00178         allACK = TRUE;
00179         for (a=0;a<registered->len;a++) {
00180             regprog = (RegProgram *) g_ptr_array_index (registered, a);
00181             if (!regprog->isACK && !regprog->isNACK) {
00182                 allACK = FALSE;
00183                 break;
00184             }
00185             if (regprog->isACK)
00186                 g_debug ("ACK!");
00187             if (regprog->isNACK) {
00188                 g_debug ("NACK!");
00189                 anyNACK = TRUE;
00190                 break;
00191             }
00192         }
00193         if (allACK || anyNACK)
00194             break;
00195     } while (g_timer_elapsed (gt, NULL) < maxwait);
00196 
00197     regprog->isACK = FALSE;
00198     regprog->isNACK = FALSE;
00199 
00200     if (anyNACK) {
00201         GString *gs = g_string_new ("");
00202         gchar *actionstr = convert_dbus_enum_to_string (action);
00203         g_string_printf (gs, _("The program '%s' is preventing the %s "
00204                        "from occurring.\n\n"
00205                        "The explanation given is: %s"),
00206                      regprog->appName->str, actionstr, regprog->reason->str);
00207         libnotify_event (gs->str, LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_CRITICAL, get_notification_icon ());
00208         g_string_free (gs, TRUE);
00209         retval = FALSE;
00210         goto unref;
00211     }
00212     if (!allACK) {
00213         GString *gs = g_string_new ("");
00214         gchar *actionstr = convert_policy_to_string (action);
00215         g_string_printf (gs, _("The program '%s' has not returned data that "
00216                      "is preventing the %s from occurring."),
00217                      regprog->appName->str, actionstr);
00218         libnotify_event (gs->str, LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_CRITICAL, get_notification_icon ());
00219         g_string_free (gs, TRUE);
00220         retval = FALSE;
00221         goto unref;
00222     }
00223 #endif
00224     gpm_emit_performing_action (action);
00225     return TRUE;
00226 }
00227 
00234 void
00235 action_policy_do (gint policy_number)
00236 {
00237 #if GPM_SIMULATE
00238     g_warning ("Ignoring action_policy_do event as simulating!");
00239     return;
00240 #endif
00241     gint value;
00242     GConfClient *client = gconf_client_get_default ();
00243     if (policy_number == ACTION_NOTHING) {
00244         g_debug ("*ACTION* Doing nothing");
00245     } else if (policy_number == ACTION_WARNING) {
00246         g_warning ("*ACTION* Send warning should be done locally!");
00247     } else if (policy_number == ACTION_REBOOT && dbus_action (GPM_DBUS_SHUTDOWN)) {
00248         g_debug ("*ACTION* Reboot");
00249         run_gconf_script (GCONF_ROOT "general/cmd_reboot");
00250     } else if (policy_number == ACTION_SUSPEND && dbus_action (GPM_DBUS_SUSPEND)) {
00251         g_debug ("*ACTION* Suspend");
00252         gscreensaver_lock_check ();
00253         hal_suspend (0);
00254     } else if (policy_number == ACTION_HIBERNATE && dbus_action (GPM_DBUS_HIBERNATE)) {
00255         g_debug ("*ACTION* Hibernate");
00256         gscreensaver_lock_check ();
00257         hal_hibernate ();
00258     } else if (policy_number == ACTION_SHUTDOWN && dbus_action (GPM_DBUS_SHUTDOWN)) {
00259         g_debug ("*ACTION* Shutdown");
00260         run_gconf_script (GCONF_ROOT "general/cmd_shutdown");
00261     } else if (policy_number == ACTION_NOW_BATTERYPOWERED) {
00262         /*
00263          * This case does 5 things:
00264          *
00265          * 1. Sets the brightness level
00266          * 2. Sets HAL to be in LaptopMode (only if laptop)
00267          * 3. Sets DPMS timeout to be our batteries policy value
00268          * 4. Sets GNOME Screensaver to not run fancy screensavers
00269          * 5. Sets our inactivity sleep timeout to batteries policy
00270          */
00271         g_debug ("*DBUS* Now battery powered");
00272         /* set brightness and lowpower mode */
00273         value = gconf_client_get_int (client,
00274                 GCONF_ROOT "policy/battery/brightness", NULL);
00275         hal_set_brightness_dim (value);
00276         hal_setlowpowermode (TRUE);
00277         /* set gnome screensaver dpms_suspend to our value */
00278         value = gconf_client_get_int (client,
00279                 GCONF_ROOT "policy/battery/sleep_display", NULL);
00280         gscreensaver_set_dpms_timeout (value);
00281         /*
00282          * make sure gnome-screensaver disables screensaving,
00283          * and enables monitor shut-off instead
00284          */
00285         gscreensaver_set_throttle (TRUE);
00286         /* set the new sleep (inactivity) value */
00287         value = gconf_client_get_int (client,
00288             GCONF_ROOT "policy/battery/sleep_computer", NULL);
00289         gpm_idle_set_timeout (value);
00290         /* emit siganal */
00291         gpm_emit_mains_changed (FALSE);
00292     } else if (policy_number == ACTION_NOW_MAINSPOWERED) {
00293         /*
00294          * This case does 5 things:
00295          *
00296          * 1. Sets the brightness level
00297          * 2. Sets HAL to not be in LaptopMode
00298          * 3. Sets DPMS timeout to be our ac policy value
00299          * 4. Sets GNOME Screensaver to run fancy screensavers
00300          * 5. Sets our inactivity sleep timeout to ac policy
00301          */
00302         g_debug ("*DBUS* Now mains powered");
00303         /* set brightness and lowpower mode */
00304         value = gconf_client_get_int (client,
00305             GCONF_ROOT "policy/ac/brightness", NULL);
00306         hal_set_brightness_dim (value);
00307         hal_setlowpowermode (TRUE);
00308         /* set dpms_suspend to our value */
00309         value = gconf_client_get_int (client,
00310                 GCONF_ROOT "policy/ac/sleep_display", NULL);
00311         gscreensaver_set_dpms_timeout (value);
00312         /* make sure gnome-screensaver enables screensaving */
00313         gscreensaver_set_throttle (FALSE);
00314         /* set the new sleep (inactivity) value */
00315         value = gconf_client_get_int (client,
00316                 GCONF_ROOT "policy/ac/sleep_computer", NULL);
00317         gpm_idle_set_timeout (value);
00318         /* emit siganal */
00319         gpm_emit_mains_changed (TRUE);
00320     } else
00321         g_warning ("action_policy_do called with unknown action %i",
00322             policy_number);
00323 }
00324 
00330 static void
00331 update_state_logic (GPtrArray *parray, gboolean coldplug)
00332 {
00333     gint a;
00334     GenericObject *slotData = NULL;
00335     /* set up temp. state */
00336     StateData state_datanew;
00337     gboolean hasBatteries;
00338     gboolean hasAcAdapter;
00339     gint policy;
00340 
00341     /* assertion checks */
00342     g_assert (parray);
00343 
00344     state_datanew.onBatteryPower = FALSE;
00345     state_datanew.onUPSPower = FALSE;
00346     hasBatteries = FALSE;
00347     hasAcAdapter = FALSE;
00348 
00349     for (a=0;a<parray->len;a++) {
00350         slotData = (GenericObject *) g_ptr_array_index (parray, a);
00351         if (slotData->powerDevice == POWER_PRIMARY_BATTERY)
00352             if (slotData->present)
00353                 hasBatteries = TRUE;
00354             else
00355                 g_debug ("Battery '%s' missing?!?", slotData->udi);
00356         else if (slotData->powerDevice == POWER_AC_ADAPTER)
00357             hasAcAdapter = TRUE;
00358         if (slotData->powerDevice == POWER_UPS && slotData->isDischarging)
00359             state_datanew.onUPSPower = TRUE;
00360     }
00361 
00362     /* get old value */
00363     if (hasBatteries) {
00364         /* Reverse logic as only one ac_adapter is needed to be "on mains power" */
00365         for (a=0;a<parray->len;a++) {
00366             slotData = (GenericObject *) g_ptr_array_index (parray, a);
00367             if (slotData->powerDevice == POWER_AC_ADAPTER && !slotData->present) {
00368                 g_debug ("onBatteryPower TRUE as ac_adapter not present");
00369                 state_datanew.onBatteryPower = TRUE;
00370                 break;
00371                 }
00372         }
00373     } else {
00374         g_debug ("Cannot be on batteries if have none...");
00375         state_datanew.onBatteryPower = FALSE;
00376     }
00377     g_debug ("onBatteryPower = %i (coldplug=%i)", state_datanew.onBatteryPower, coldplug);
00378 
00379     if (coldplug || state_datanew.onBatteryPower != state_data.onBatteryPower) {
00380         state_data.onBatteryPower = state_datanew.onBatteryPower;
00381         if (state_data.onBatteryPower) {
00382             action_policy_do (ACTION_NOW_BATTERYPOWERED);
00383             policy = get_policy_string (GCONF_ROOT "policy/ac_fail");
00384             /* only do notification if not coldplug */
00385             if (!coldplug) {
00386                 if (policy == ACTION_WARNING)
00387                     libnotify_event (_("AC Adapter has been removed"),
00388                         LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_NORMAL, get_notification_icon ());
00389                 else
00390                     action_policy_do (policy);
00391                 }
00392         } else {
00393             action_policy_do (ACTION_NOW_MAINSPOWERED);
00394         }
00395     }
00396 
00397     if (coldplug || state_datanew.onUPSPower != state_data.onUPSPower) {
00398         state_data.onUPSPower = state_datanew.onUPSPower;
00399         g_debug ("DBUS: %s = %i", "onUPSPower", state_data.onUPSPower);
00400     }
00401 }
00402 
00406 static void
00407 gpm_exit (void)
00408 {
00409     gint a;
00410     g_debug ("Quitting!");
00411 
00412     /* free objectData */
00413     for (a=0;a<objectData->len;a++)
00414         g_free (g_ptr_array_index (objectData, a));
00415     g_ptr_array_free (objectData, TRUE);
00416 
00417     /* free registered */
00418     for (a=0;a<registered->len;a++)
00419         g_free (g_ptr_array_index (registered, a));
00420     g_ptr_array_free (registered, TRUE);
00421 
00422     /* free glibhal callbacks */
00423     glibhal_callback_shutdown ();
00424 
00425     /* free icon */
00426     gpn_icon_destroy ();
00427     exit (0);
00428 }
00429 
00435 static gboolean
00436 add_ac_adapter (const gchar *udi)
00437 {
00438     GenericObject *slotData = NULL;
00439 
00440     /* assertion checks */
00441     g_assert (udi);
00442 
00443     slotData = genericobject_add (objectData, udi);
00444     if (!slotData) {
00445         g_warning ("Cannot add '%s' object to table!", udi);
00446         return FALSE;
00447     }
00448 
00449     /* register this with HAL so we get PropertyModified events */
00450     glibhal_watch_add_device_property_modified (udi);
00451 
00452     slotData->powerDevice = POWER_AC_ADAPTER;
00453     slotData->percentageCharge = 0;
00454     g_debug ("Device '%s' added", udi);
00455     /* ac_adapter batteries might be missing */
00456     hal_device_get_bool (udi, "ac_adapter.present", &slotData->present);
00457     slotData->isRechargeable = FALSE;
00458     slotData->isCharging = FALSE;
00459     slotData->isDischarging = FALSE;
00460     slotData->isRechargeable = 0;
00461     slotData->percentageCharge = 0;
00462     slotData->minutesRemaining = 0;
00463     return TRUE;
00464 }
00465 
00471 static gboolean
00472 read_battery_data (GenericObject *slotData)
00473 {
00474     gint tempval;
00475 
00476     /* assertion checks */
00477     g_assert (slotData);
00478 
00479     /* initialise to known defaults */
00480     slotData->minutesRemaining = 0;
00481     slotData->isRechargeable = FALSE;
00482     slotData->isCharging = FALSE;
00483     slotData->isDischarging = FALSE;
00484 
00485     if (!slotData->present) {
00486         g_debug ("Battery %s not present!", slotData->udi);
00487         return FALSE;
00488     }
00489 
00490     /* set cached variables up */
00491     hal_device_get_int (slotData->udi, "battery.remaining_time", &tempval);
00492     if (tempval > 0)
00493         slotData->minutesRemaining = tempval / 60;
00494 
00495     hal_device_get_int (slotData->udi, "battery.charge_level.percentage",
00496         &slotData->percentageCharge);
00497     /* battery might not be rechargeable, have to check */
00498     hal_device_get_bool (slotData->udi, "battery.is_rechargeable",
00499         &slotData->isRechargeable);
00500     if (slotData->isRechargeable) {
00501         hal_device_get_bool (slotData->udi, "battery.rechargeable.is_charging",
00502             &slotData->isCharging);
00503         hal_device_get_bool (slotData->udi, "battery.rechargeable.is_discharging",
00504             &slotData->isDischarging);
00505     }
00506     return TRUE;
00507 }
00508 
00514 static gboolean
00515 add_battery (const gchar *udi)
00516 {
00517     gchar *type = NULL;
00518     gchar *device = NULL;
00519     GenericObject *slotData = NULL;
00520 
00521     /* assertion checks */
00522     g_assert (udi);
00523 
00524     slotData = genericobject_add (objectData, udi);
00525     if (!slotData) {
00526         g_debug ("Cannot add '%s' object to table!", udi);
00527         return FALSE;
00528     }
00529 
00530     /* PMU/ACPI batteries might be missing */
00531     hal_device_get_bool (udi, "battery.present", &slotData->present);
00532 
00533     /* battery is refined using the .type property */
00534     hal_device_get_string (udi, "battery.type", &type);
00535     if (!type) {
00536         g_warning ("Battery %s has no type!", udi);
00537         return FALSE;
00538     }
00539 
00540     /* register this with HAL so we get PropertyModified events */
00541     glibhal_watch_add_device_property_modified (udi);
00542 
00543     slotData->powerDevice = convert_haltype_to_powerdevice (type);
00544     g_free (type);
00545 
00546     device = convert_powerdevice_to_string (slotData->powerDevice);
00547     g_debug ("%s added", device);
00548 
00549     /* read in values */
00550     read_battery_data (slotData);
00551     return TRUE;
00552 }
00553 
00558 static gboolean
00559 coldplug_batteries (void)
00560 {
00561     gint i;
00562     gchar **device_names = NULL;
00563     /* devices of type battery */
00564     hal_find_device_capability ("battery", &device_names);
00565     if (!device_names) {
00566         g_debug ("Couldn't obtain list of batteries");
00567         return FALSE;
00568     }
00569     for (i = 0; device_names[i]; i++)
00570         add_battery (device_names[i]);
00571     hal_free_capability (device_names);
00572     return TRUE;
00573 }
00574 
00579 static gboolean
00580 coldplug_acadapter (void)
00581 {
00582     gint i;
00583     gchar **device_names = NULL;
00584     /* devices of type ac_adapter */
00585     hal_find_device_capability ("ac_adapter", &device_names);
00586     if (!device_names) {
00587         g_debug ("Couldn't obtain list of ac_adapters");
00588         return FALSE;
00589     }
00590     for (i = 0; device_names[i]; i++)
00591         add_ac_adapter (device_names[i]);
00592     hal_free_capability (device_names);
00593     return TRUE;
00594 }
00595 
00600 static gboolean
00601 coldplug_buttons (void)
00602 {
00603     gint i;
00604     gchar **device_names = NULL;
00605     /* devices of type button */
00606     hal_find_device_capability ("button", &device_names);
00607     if (!device_names) {
00608         g_debug ("Couldn't obtain list of buttons");
00609         return FALSE;
00610     }
00611     for (i = 0; device_names[i]; i++) {
00612         /*
00613          * We register this here, as buttons are not present
00614          * in object data, and do not need to be added manually.
00615         */
00616         glibhal_watch_add_device_condition (device_names[i]);
00617     }
00618     hal_free_capability (device_names);
00619     return TRUE;
00620 }
00621 
00628 static void
00629 hal_device_removed (const gchar *udi)
00630 {
00631     int a;
00632 
00633     /* assertion checks */
00634     g_assert (udi);
00635 
00636     g_debug ("hal_device_removed: udi=%s", udi);
00637     /*
00638      * UPS's/mice/keyboards don't use battery.present
00639      * they just disappear from the device tree
00640      */
00641     a = find_udi_parray_index (objectData, udi);
00642     if (a == -1) {
00643         g_debug ("Asked to remove '%s' when not present", udi);
00644         return;
00645     }
00646     g_debug ("Removed '%s'", udi);
00647     g_ptr_array_remove_index (objectData, a);
00648     /* remove watch */
00649     glibhal_watch_remove_device_property_modified (udi);
00650     /* our state has changed, update */
00651     update_state_logic (objectData, FALSE);
00652     gpn_icon_update ();
00653 }
00654 
00661 static void
00662 hal_device_new_capability (const gchar *udi, const gchar *capability)
00663 {
00664     /* assertion checks */
00665     g_assert (udi);
00666     g_assert (capability);
00667     g_debug ("hal_device_new_capability: udi=%s, capability=%s",
00668         udi, capability);
00669     /*
00670      * UPS's/mice/keyboards don't use battery.present
00671      * they just appear in the device tree
00672      */
00673     if (strcmp (capability, "battery") == 0) {
00674         add_battery (udi);
00675         /* our state has changed, update */
00676         update_state_logic (objectData, FALSE);
00677         gpn_icon_update ();
00678     }
00679 }
00680 
00688 static gboolean
00689 notify_user_low_batt (GenericObject *slotData, gint newCharge)
00690 {
00691     GConfClient *client = NULL;
00692     gint lowThreshold;
00693     gint criticalThreshold;
00694     GString *gs = NULL;
00695     GString *remaining = NULL;
00696     gchar *device = NULL;
00697 
00698     /* assertion checks */
00699     g_assert (slotData);
00700 
00701     if (!slotData->isDischarging) {
00702         g_debug ("battery is not discharging!");
00703         return FALSE;
00704     }
00705 
00706     client = gconf_client_get_default ();
00707     lowThreshold = gconf_client_get_int (client,
00708         GCONF_ROOT "general/threshold_low", NULL);
00709     criticalThreshold = gconf_client_get_int (client,
00710         GCONF_ROOT "general/threshold_critical", NULL);
00711     g_debug ("lowThreshold = %i, criticalThreshold = %i",
00712         lowThreshold, criticalThreshold);
00713 
00714     /* critical warning */
00715     if (newCharge < criticalThreshold) {
00716         g_debug ("battery is critical!");
00717         gint policy = get_policy_string (GCONF_ROOT "policy/battery_critical");
00718         if (policy == ACTION_WARNING) {
00719             device = convert_powerdevice_to_string (slotData->powerDevice);
00720             remaining = get_time_string (slotData);;
00721             gs = g_string_new ("");
00722             g_string_printf (gs, _("The %s (%i%%) is <b>critically low</b>\n(%s)"),
00723                 device, newCharge, remaining->str);
00724             libnotify_event (gs->str, LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_CRITICAL,
00725                 get_notification_icon ());
00726             g_string_free (gs, TRUE);
00727             g_string_free (remaining, TRUE);
00728         } else
00729             action_policy_do (policy);
00730         return TRUE;
00731     }
00732     /* low warning */
00733     if (newCharge < lowThreshold) {
00734         g_debug ("battery is low!");
00735         device = convert_powerdevice_to_string (slotData->powerDevice);
00736         remaining = get_time_string (slotData);;
00737         gs = g_string_new ("");
00738         g_string_printf (gs, _("The %s (%i%%) is <b>low</b>\n(%s)"),
00739             device, newCharge, remaining->str);
00740         libnotify_event (gs->str, LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_CRITICAL,
00741             get_notification_icon ());
00742         g_string_free (gs, TRUE);
00743         g_string_free (remaining, TRUE);
00744         return TRUE;
00745     }
00746     return FALSE;
00747 }
00748 
00757 static void
00758 hal_device_property_modified (const gchar *udi,
00759     const gchar *key,
00760     gboolean is_added,
00761     gboolean is_removed)
00762 {
00763     GenericObject *slotData = NULL;
00764     GenericObject slotDataVirt;
00765     gboolean updateState;
00766     gint oldCharge;
00767     gint newCharge;
00768 
00769     /* assertion checks */
00770     g_assert (udi);
00771     g_assert (key);
00772 
00773     g_debug ("hal_device_property_modified: udi=%s, key=%s, added=%i, removed=%i",
00774         udi, key, is_added, is_removed);
00775 
00776     /* only process modified entries, not added or removed keys */
00777     if (is_removed||is_added)
00778         return;
00779 
00780     /* no point continuing any further if we are never going to match ...*/
00781     if (strncmp (key, "battery", 7) != 0 && strncmp (key, "ac_adapter", 10) != 0)
00782         return;
00783 
00784     slotData = genericobject_find (objectData, udi);
00785     /*
00786      * if we BUG here then *HAL* has a problem where key modification is
00787      * done before capability is present
00788      */
00789     if (!slotData) {
00790         g_warning ("slotData is NULL! udi=%s\n"
00791                "This is probably a bug in HAL where we are getting "
00792                "is_removed=false, is_added=false before the capability "
00793                "had been added. In addon-hid-ups this is likely to happen."
00794                , udi);
00795         return;
00796     }
00797     updateState = FALSE;
00798 
00799     /* find old percentageCharge (taking into account multi-device machines) */
00800     if (slotData->isRechargeable) {
00801         slotDataVirt.percentageCharge = 100;
00802         create_virtual_of_type (objectData, &slotDataVirt, slotData->powerDevice);
00803         oldCharge = slotDataVirt.percentageCharge;
00804     } else
00805         oldCharge = slotData->percentageCharge;
00806 
00807     /* update values in the struct */
00808     if (strcmp (key, "battery.present") == 0) {
00809         hal_device_get_bool (udi, key, &slotData->present);
00810         /* read in values */
00811         read_battery_data (slotData);
00812         updateState = TRUE;
00813     } else if (strcmp (key, "ac_adapter.present") == 0) {
00814         hal_device_get_bool (udi, key, &slotData->present);
00815         updateState = TRUE;
00816     } else if (strcmp (key, "battery.rechargeable.is_charging") == 0) {
00817         hal_device_get_bool (udi, key, &slotData->isCharging);
00818         updateState = TRUE;
00819     } else if (strcmp (key, "battery.rechargeable.is_discharging") == 0) {
00820         hal_device_get_bool (udi, key, &slotData->isDischarging);
00821         updateState = TRUE;
00822     } else if (strcmp (key, "battery.charge_level.percentage") == 0) {
00823         hal_device_get_int (udi, key, &slotData->percentageCharge);
00824     } else if (strcmp (key, "battery.remaining_time") == 0) {
00825         gint tempval;
00826         hal_device_get_int (udi, key, &tempval);
00827         if (tempval > 0)
00828             slotData->minutesRemaining = tempval / 60;
00829     } else
00830         /* ignore */
00831         return;
00832 
00833     if (updateState)
00834         update_state_logic (objectData, FALSE);
00835 
00836     /* find new percentageCharge (taking into account multi-device machines) */
00837     if (slotData->isRechargeable) {
00838         slotDataVirt.percentageCharge = 100;
00839         create_virtual_of_type (objectData, &slotDataVirt, slotData->powerDevice);
00840         newCharge = slotDataVirt.percentageCharge;
00841     } else
00842         newCharge = slotData->percentageCharge;
00843     g_debug ("newCharge = %i, oldCharge = %i", newCharge, oldCharge);
00844 
00845     /* update icon */
00846     gpn_icon_update ();
00847 
00848     /* do we need to notify the user we are getting low ? */
00849     if (oldCharge != newCharge) {
00850         g_debug ("percentage change %i -> %i", oldCharge, newCharge);
00851         notify_user_low_batt (slotData, newCharge);
00852     }
00853 }
00854 
00862 static void
00863 hal_device_condition (const gchar *udi,
00864     const gchar *condition_name,
00865     const gchar *condition_details)
00866 {
00867     gchar *type = NULL;
00868     gint policy;
00869     gboolean value;
00870 
00871     /* assertion checks */
00872     g_assert (udi);
00873     g_assert (condition_name);
00874     g_assert (condition_details);
00875 
00876     g_debug ("hal_device_condition: udi=%s, condition_name=%s, condition_details=%s",
00877         udi, condition_name, condition_details);
00878 
00879     if (strcmp (condition_name, "ButtonPressed") == 0) {
00880         hal_device_get_string (udi, "button.type", &type);
00881         g_debug ("ButtonPressed : %s", type);
00882         if (strcmp (type, "power") == 0) {
00883             policy = get_policy_string (GCONF_ROOT "policy/button_power");
00884             if (policy == ACTION_WARNING)
00885                 libnotify_event (_("Power button has been pressed"),
00886                     LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_NORMAL, get_notification_icon ());
00887             else
00888                 action_policy_do (policy);
00889         } else if (strcmp (type, "sleep") == 0) {
00890             policy = get_policy_string (GCONF_ROOT "policy/button_suspend");
00891             if (policy == ACTION_WARNING)
00892                 libnotify_event (_("Sleep button has been pressed"),
00893                     LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_NORMAL, get_notification_icon ());
00894             else
00895                 action_policy_do (policy);
00896         } else if (strcmp (type, "lid") == 0) {
00897             /* we only do a lid event when the lid is OPENED */
00898             hal_device_get_bool (udi, "button.state.value", &value);
00899             if (value) {
00900                 gint policy = get_policy_string (GCONF_ROOT "policy/button_lid");
00901                 if (policy == ACTION_WARNING)
00902                     libnotify_event (_("Lid has been opened"),
00903                         LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_NORMAL, get_notification_icon ());
00904                 else
00905                     action_policy_do (policy);
00906             }
00907         } else
00908             g_warning ("Button '%s' unrecognised", type);
00909         g_free (type);
00910     }
00911 }
00912 
00916 static void
00917 print_usage (void)
00918 {
00919     g_print ("usage : gnome-power-manager [options]\n");
00920     g_print (
00921         "\n"
00922         "    --disable        Do not perform the action, e.g. suspend\n"
00923         "    --no-daemon      Do not daemonize.\n"
00924         "    --verbose        Show extra debugging\n"
00925         "    --version        Show the installed version and quit\n"
00926         "    --help           Show this information and exit\n"
00927         "\n");
00928 }
00929 
00934 void
00935 idle_callback (gint timeout)
00936 {
00937     gint policy;
00938     GString *gs;
00939 
00940     gs = g_string_new ("");
00941     g_string_printf (gs, _("Computer has been idle for %i minutes"), timeout);
00942     policy = get_policy_string (GCONF_ROOT "policy/ac_fail");
00943     libnotify_event (gs->str, LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_NORMAL, get_notification_icon ());
00944     /* can only be hibernate or suspend */
00945     action_policy_do (policy);
00946     g_string_free (gs, TRUE);
00947 }
00948 
00955 int
00956 main (int argc, char *argv[])
00957 {
00958     gint a;
00959     gint value;
00960     GMainLoop *loop = NULL;
00961     GConfClient *client = NULL;
00962     GnomeClient *master = NULL;
00963     GnomeClientFlags flags;
00964     DBusGConnection *system_connection = NULL;
00965     DBusGConnection *session_connection = NULL;
00966     gboolean no_daemon = FALSE;
00967 
00968     g_type_init ();
00969     if (!g_thread_supported ())
00970         g_thread_init (NULL);
00971     dbus_g_thread_init ();
00972     dbus_g_object_type_install_info (gpm_object_get_type (),
00973         &dbus_glib_gpm_object_object_info);
00974 
00975     gconf_init (argc, argv, NULL);
00976     client = gconf_client_get_default ();
00977     gconf_client_add_dir (client, GCONF_ROOT_SANS_SLASH,
00978         GCONF_CLIENT_PRELOAD_NONE, NULL);
00979     gconf_client_notify_add (client, GCONF_ROOT_SANS_SLASH,
00980         callback_gconf_key_changed, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00981 
00982     bindtextdomain (GETTEXT_PACKAGE, GNOMELOCALEDIR);
00983     bind_textdomain_codeset (GETTEXT_PACKAGE, "UTF-8");
00984     textdomain (GETTEXT_PACKAGE);
00985 
00986     isVerbose = FALSE;
00987     for (a=1; a < argc; a++) {
00988         if (strcmp (argv[a], "--verbose") == 0)
00989             isVerbose = TRUE;
00990         else if (strcmp (argv[a], "--version") == 0) {
00991             g_print ("%s %s", NICENAME, VERSION);
00992             return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00993         }
00994         else if (strcmp (argv[a], "--no-daemon") == 0)
00995             no_daemon = TRUE;
00996         else if (strcmp (argv[a], "--help") == 0) {
00997             print_usage ();
00998             return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00999         }
01000     }
01001 
01002     /* set log level */
01003     if (!isVerbose)
01004         g_log_set_handler (G_LOG_DOMAIN, G_LOG_LEVEL_DEBUG,
01005             g_log_ignore, NULL);
01006 
01007     /* check dbus connections, exit if not valid */
01008     if (!dbus_get_system_connection (&system_connection))
01009         exit (1);
01010     if (!dbus_get_session_connection (&session_connection))
01011         exit (1);
01012 
01013     /* initialise gnome */
01014     gnome_program_init (NICENAME, VERSION, LIBGNOMEUI_MODULE, argc, argv, NULL);
01015     master = gnome_master_client ();
01016     flags = gnome_client_get_flags (master);
01017     if (flags & GNOME_CLIENT_IS_CONNECTED) {
01018         gnome_client_set_restart_style (master, GNOME_RESTART_IMMEDIATELY);
01019         gnome_client_flush (master);
01020     }
01021     g_signal_connect (GTK_OBJECT (master), "die", G_CALLBACK (gpm_exit), NULL);
01022 
01023     /* Initialise libnotify, if compiled in. */
01024     if (!libnotify_init (NICENAME))
01025         g_error ("Cannot initialise libnotify!");
01026 
01027     g_print ("%s %s - %s\n", NICENAME, VERSION, NICEDESC);
01028     g_print (_("Report bugs to richard@hughsie.com\n"));
01029     g_print (_("Please check the faq page before reporting bugs!\n"));
01030     g_print ("  * http://gnome-power.sourceforge.net/faq.php *\n");
01031 
01032     if (!no_daemon && daemon (0, 0))
01033         g_error ("Could not daemonize: %s", g_strerror (errno));
01034 
01035     /* register dbus service */
01036     if (!gpm_object_register ()) {
01037         g_warning ("GNOME Power Manager is already running in this session.");
01038         return 0;
01039     }
01040 
01041     loop = g_main_loop_new (NULL, FALSE);
01042     /* check HAL is running */
01043     if (!is_hald_running ()) {
01044         libnotify_event (_("GNOME Power Manager cannot connect to HAL!"),
01045             LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_CRITICAL, NULL);
01046         exit (1);
01047     }
01048 
01049     /* check we have PM capability */
01050     if (!hal_pm_check ()) {
01051         libnotify_event (_("HAL does not have PowerManagement capability"),
01052             LIBNOTIFY_URGENCY_CRITICAL, NULL);
01053         exit (1);
01054     }
01055 
01056     glibhal_callback_init ();
01057     /* assign the callback functions */
01058     glibhal_method_device_removed (hal_device_removed);
01059     glibhal_method_device_new_capability (hal_device_new_capability);
01060     glibhal_method_device_property_modified (hal_device_property_modified);
01061     glibhal_method_device_condition (hal_device_condition);
01062 
01063     objectData = g_ptr_array_new ();
01064     registered = g_ptr_array_new ();
01065 
01066     /* sets up these devices in the objectData and adds watches */
01067     coldplug_batteries ();
01068     coldplug_acadapter ();
01069     coldplug_buttons ();
01070 
01071     update_state_logic (objectData, TRUE);
01072     gpn_icon_update ();
01073 
01074     /* get idle value from gconf */
01075     if (state_data.onBatteryPower) {
01076         value = gconf_client_get_int (client, 
01077             GCONF_ROOT "policy/battery/sleep_computer", NULL);
01078     } else {
01079         value = gconf_client_get_int (client,
01080             GCONF_ROOT "policy/ac/sleep_computer", NULL);
01081     }
01082     gpm_idle_set_timeout (value);
01083     
01084     /* set callback for the timout action */
01085     gpm_idle_set_callback (idle_callback);
01086 
01087     /* set up idle calculation function */
01088     g_timeout_add (POLL_FREQUENCY * 1000, gpm_idle_update, NULL);
01089 
01090     g_main_loop_run (loop);
01091 
01092     gpm_exit ();
01093     return 0;
01094 }
